results.title: Real inside
results.creator_credit: John Weldon, David Verrall, Derek Lamb, Douglas MacDonald and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Meet Buck Boom—dynamic, forceful and creative—and a candidate for the job of executive assistant at a staid corporation. There’s no doubt in Boom’s mind that he’s the person for the job, but the question is, can he convince Mr. Mudgin, the personnel manager? For, you see, Boom is a cartoon and Mudgin is not used to dealing with someone who is “different.” Skillfully crafted, using an innovative combination of live action and animation techniques, this hilarious short film probes stereotypes, prejudices and hiring practices.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Weldon, David Verrall, Derek Lamb, Douglas MacDonald and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Ready when you are Mr McGill
results.creator_credit: Mike Newell, Michael Dunlop and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: A film about the making of a television film, which gently satirises all the members of a film unit, and is a lesson in how not to direct a television play. The story is seen through the eyes of Joe McGill, a professional television extra given his first speaking part of two lines. But everything that can possibly go wrong in location filming, does go wrong. Stars Jack Shepard.

results.title: Ready to type
results.brief_description: Designed for showing to students beginning typing classes. Shows the importance of developing a procedure for getting ready to type. A comparison is made between two students, one of whom follows a pattern of procedure and the other who commences work without any preparation.

results.creator_credit: Adam Stockhausen, Dan Farah, Kristie Macosko, Ernest Cline, Kasia Walicka-Maimone, Donald De Line, Zak Penn, Steven Spielberg, Village Roadshow Pictures, Reliance Entertainment, Farah Films & Management, Dune Entertainment, Warner Bros. Pictures, De Line Pictures and Amblin Entertainment
results.brief_description: When the creator of a popular video game system dies, a virtual contest is created to compete for his fortune.

constellations_other.name: The Wilhelm scream, easters eggs and open world games
constellations_other.description: This Constellation tracks how an on-set in-joke became one of the first cinematic easter eggs. It was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Harrison Buikstra and Jasper Caverly.

results.title: Ready or not
results.creator_credit: Colin Budds, David Campbell, Michael Vaughan and Film Victoria
results.brief_description: Conflict arises when a small factory facing closure is taken over by a large corporation who use it as a test case for the introduction of modern computerised manufacturing equipment. Relations between workers, management and unions deteriorate rapidly until an accident in the factory brings differences to a head.

results.title: Ready or not
results.creator_credit: Pamela Eagles, Dom Clausen, Dianne Milwright and Myles-Milwright Productions
results.brief_description: As all children are different and develop at different rates it is not easy to identify school readiness. This program assists in identifying this stage by showing aspects of school life that children will encounter. Discusses how early experiences in the family and at preschool develop physical, social and intellectual maturity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pamela Eagles, Dom Clausen, Dianne Milwright and Myles-Milwright Productions

results.title: Ready for the hills
results.creator_credit: Peter Halket, Maurice Dybeck and Explorer Films
results.brief_description: A training film on the basic essentials of hillcraft including training beforehand, blisters and the need for boots, type of anorak; windproof or waterproof, keeping together, the correct pace; how to walk, ascent and descent; the need for a leader, contrasts in weather conditions, food for lunch; emergency rations, drinking water and other refreshments, litter, first aid kit, map and compass, staying at youth hostels.

results.title: Ready for action
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Eric Thompson, Forestry and Timber Bureau (Australia) and Australian news and Information Bureau
results.brief_description: Film trailer on bushfire prevention. Summer always brings the curse of fire. Photographed at a fire-control field day held at Wyong, N.S.W., this short film illustrates how firemen prepare for the threat of fire. They overhaul their organisation, communications equipment and gear; safeguard buildings before the fire season commences; practise in using fire-fighting equipment; construct fire-breaks and practice mopping up after a fire.

results.title: Ready and able
results.brief_description: Members of the CFA provide practical advice on how to prepare for and survive a major catastrophe like a bushfire or a flood. These interviews were conducted in light of the tragic Black Saturday bushfires in February 2009.
